Hi Ron,

 

Hako-midare, ko-ashi hataraku might be closer, but a picture would help.

 

Gordon

 

-----Original Message-----
From: Ron Hartmann [mailto:swords@...] 
Sent: Saturday, July 24, 2004 1:25 AM
To: TOKEN; nihontostudy; nihonto@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [nihontostudy] Hamon description

 

Curious about the correct way to describe a particular style of hamon which
I'd describe as a smallish gunome with ko-ashi, in groups of five or six
gunome. Each section of gunome is seperated with a slightly larger ashi,
which while subtle, does make the straight gunmome hamon appear in "groups"
of gunome. Hope that is clear.

One term I find is called "sugu ashi iri" which I take to mean, "suguha
containing ashi." 

The pattern I'm trying to describe would see (to me) correctly described as
something like "sugu kaku (boxed) gunome ashi iri" or am I sounding too
midwestern with my Japanese??  Any comments?  If a small sketch (file) would
help, I'll send one out.

Ron
STL
